revised_title: Magnetohydrodynamic Power Generation: Equilibrium and Non-Equilibrium Electrical Conductivity of Seeded Combustion Products
tldr: This article discusses advanced methods of energy conversion, specifically magnetohydrodynamic power generation. It explores the equilibrium and non-equilibrium electrical conductivity of seeded combustion products, which affects the efficiency and performance of generators. The authors present experiments and a theory to explain their results and consider potential applications to generators.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Power Generation and Storage
